physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Cachectic and bedridden patient had multiple cystic tumors on both sides of her face, scalp, and the right side of her body, arranged in a bandlike distribution, following Blaschkoâ€™s lines. The cysts formed large conglomerates and were covered with multiple filiform hyperkeratoses and comedo-like plugs. One cyst in the sacral area was inflamed and released malodorous material.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The lumps increased in number and size with age, leading to some being excised due to inflammation and fistula formation. Additionally, by 26 years of age, the patient became wheelchair-bound due to severe arthrosis and leg bowing.
